chargeHist.descr: Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/Operate While und. Influence and Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15). The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und. Influence and the other charge, Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15) was dismissed by the court.

  • James Tyler Novotny was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und. Influence, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent. 99 days credit for revocation purposes.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to attend the Alcohol Victim Impact Panel at 7:00 p.m. on 11-15-2022, must attend one time in 2022 and 1 time in 2023.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to complete an AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to undergo a mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment/counseling.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.  The Defendant is subject to random drug/UA testing.

timeConds.notes: Work Release granted for work, school or treatment.
